criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the clinician-stated diagnosis of a sinus infection exactly as expressed in the transcript.
Reward for faithfully recording the prescription of penicillin for 10 days, matching drug name and duration as spoken.
Reward for capturing the patient’s verbal agreement to start the medication tonight, reflecting the patient’s own words or clear paraphrase.
Reward for correctly including the chart-documented severe penicillin allergy (drug name and severity) without alteration or contradiction.
Reward for overall completeness: the note covers every clinically relevant fact, action, or statement present in the transcript, with no omissions.
Penalize for omitting any key element explicitly present in the transcript or relevant chart data (diagnosis, prescription details, patient agreement, or penicillin allergy).
Penalize for introducing information not supported by the transcript or chart (e.g., different drug, dosage, side-effects counseling, physical exam findings, or additional diagnoses).

Penalize for indiscriminate or inaccurate copying of chart data that was not relevant to the encounter (e.g., unrelated chronic conditions or empty sections), or for misrepresenting chart facts such as allergies or demographics.
